website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you have a large project to complete, or plan to stain your wood surfaces once filled.
pros: Versatile size options make it practical for DIY or building projects that require a lot of filler – available in quart or gallon sizes
cons: Colors can be difficult to match, and may look different when dried

customer_reviews.title: I've Used GoodFilla In The Past And Have Always Been Happy With The Results. BUT
customer_reviews.text: I received this order in an envelope. When I opened it up the top of the container was off and wood filler had come out and made a mess. I got GoodFilla on my hands trying unsuccessfully to replace the lid. This order I returned for a refund. I ordered it again... This 2nd order came in an envelope, the lid was barely on and there was dry woodfiller on the outside of the container. So this time I got woodfiller powder on my clothes. The product does seem usable so I'll keep it. I'm giving GoodFilla one star for nuisance value.
customer_reviews.author: Snow Coot

customer_reviews.title: Great filler for porous woods
customer_reviews.text: Much better product than Timbermate. Goodfilla has no offensive odor, in fact it has no smell at all, it ic creamy and wipes on easily, wipes off with a damp cloth, and drys quickly. I used the Mahogany color on Mahogany Veneer and it fills the pores nicely. My process is Transtint dye mixed in 50/50 Alcohol / Lacquer Thinner sprayed on with a Preval sprayer, spray on a coat of clear Zinnser Seal Coat Shellac, apply the Goodfilla, finish with Shellac or Oil.
customer_reviews.author: Les H

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this filla
customer_reviews.text: This wood filler works great. But you need to be careful about getting it around the area that you are filling since it is colored it can stain the surrounding wood. I learned this while testing it out on an underside surface. I then adapted my technique to eliminate the problem by applying a coat of finish prior to filling any holes. I would recommend using shellac when possible. I love how easy this filler is to use and sand. It left a great surface and didn't clog my sand paper.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Product is listed as a wood and grain filler, with instructions to mix contents with water at a 1:1 ratio for use as a grain filler. Result was the consistency of water and completely useless. All went into the trash. never again by that brand name. There is a professional product (Mohawk) that is solvent based and far superior as a grain filler.
customer_reviews.author: quality hawk

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great, fast drying, no smell like the australian stuff but buy the big jar, it goes fast
customer_reviews.author: icywalt

customer_reviews.title: Good for hobbyist use
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. Warning though: it does seem to shrink a little with temperature changes. But it goes on so easily and can be applied with bare hands. It cleans off easily as well. And it stains and paints nicely. For the ease of use and price it's fantastic. If you want a much more professional product you're going to want something that's harder to work with and more difficult to apply.
customer_reviews.author: William Winner

customer_reviews.title: A step up.
customer_reviews.text: Four star rating only because I haven't had a chance to try staining this filler. It is very easy to use but will also dry quickly if you fail to pay attention. It responds well to sanding but will also leave a shadow residue that requires some extra effort to sand out in soft woods. This is typical of most fillers I have used in the past. I haven't tried it on hard woods. Overall, it's a step up from what I have been using.
customer_reviews.author: W David Ramey

customer_reviews.title: This one will not shrink and crack, dry up fast .
customer_reviews.text: Tried other but not looking good. Finally got this one and it's much more easy to use, the most important thing is..., this one will not shrink, crack and easy to be made into smoothly surface by adding a little bit water.
customer_reviews.author: Romeo L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy clean up & good consistency
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use water based product. Not a perfect match for my table legs but a vast improvement over the giant dog tooth marks on the legs that were there when I began the refinish project. Material hardened to a sandable surface.
customer_reviews.author: Sushi Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using wood filler. I purchased a heavy 80s This end up type table that had some peeling finish and gabs between the slats on top. I have posted progressive photos. The only photo not shown is the second fill. I applied the filler before sanding and again after fully sanded as the gaps had to be built up. It survived lots of sanding, staining and a oily wax finish. I'm not sure how it will hold up but it looks great. You can barely see it as it blended in and took the darker stain very well. It is somewhat harder to sand off of bare unfinished wood. But overall this exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Yes its Me

customer_reviews.title: May be great, but lacking instructions
customer_reviews.text: This product may be great, but it's lacking instructions. Does not suggest a dry time. Name indicates that it is a wood & grain filler, then on the label says it "doesn't blind the grain." I bought it to fill the grain on a door. I diluted it (as directed on the label) and used it on one side of the door. It was dry to the touch, sanded nicely, etc. However when I started applying primer, the product globbed with a second brush stroke (image). I'm going to try it again on the reverse side, thinning it more and allowing a much longer dry time.
customer_reviews.author: teaks

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up well!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill cracks and knot areas in black walnut (several thin coats). I let the wood filler dry for several days. I then sealed the table with 5 coats of TotalBoat Halcyon Marine Varnish. After less than a year, I noticed the areas with wood filler bubbled up, while the other areas held up well. The wood filler had completely disintegrated to powder, leaving me no choice but to totally refinish the table. I'll skip using this stuff and use Penetrating Epoxy instead, as it will actually strengthen the wood fibers.
customer_reviews.author: Hepcat Vince

customer_reviews.title: Feeling very confident with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur when it comes to wood-work and need to fill in a few nooks and crannies for a wood door frame that I had custom-made for my bathroom. I was going to use brown caulk when I came across this. I plan on pre-staining the trim and then staining it dark walnut. Upon reading the feedback for the product, I came to the understanding that I wouldn't have much of a problem. Moreover, I am very impressed at the professionalism of the seller/representative of the product who took the time to respond to the comments (positive or negative). Feeling like I'm in good hands....
customer_reviews.author: Eric thigpen

customer_reviews.title: AMAZINGLY EASY!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, what a wonderful 'cheat' for worn wood on your house/in your house/on your woodwork/on your siding/on your doors. Just schmeeer it on with a butter knife/flatten it out to where it looks like the surrounding wood. You can hand sand it later if you want. And paint over it. This is better than hair extensions and Botox combined.
customer_reviews.author: Savvybuyer

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used different types of wood fill in the past but after recently moving, one of my prized pieces was damaged. Needless to say, I was heartsick. It will never be the same but this repaired it very well. I did it in three layers due to the depth of damage. I would definitely use this product again. I have no before pic but this was after the repair. Thankfully, it was toward the back of my piece..
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Sutphen

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is awful!
customer_reviews.text: I used it to fill some holes in my wooden deck. That was about two months ago. The paint has now peeled off of the spots I treated, and the off-white spots really stick out on my brown deck. This stuff is supposed to be paintable, but if the paint doesn't stick to it, what good is it?
customer_reviews.author: Terrie D

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: While it looks a lot like regular spackling paste, it has worked well for me needs, which was to fill in gaps in a door and the the wall opposite the door, when I installed a new lock. The areas I filled in, and built up, appear quite solid, as though they are actual wood. Screws that have gone into the filled in areas are securely in place. For the larger spots (holes), I built up the fill in stages. Absolutely no cracked, or size reduction, visible post drying. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hardwood floors if this is your color.... Walnut.
customer_reviews.text: As a water based filler on a prefinished wood 3/4 oak plank, it was perfect. Easy to apply, easy to clean up with a Swifter wet jet, then really easy to color match when it dried. It actually did as it said, it did NOT shrink or contract. I am very pleased as it filled and accepted my water based stain perfectly even though I am a beginner at this, it made my mistakes hardly noticeable and everyone is pleased with the new floor. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had Known About This Years Ago!
customer_reviews.text: This filler is the real deal. I used it to fill some splits and cracks on some cedar columns. This filler is so easy to work with its amazing. After drying, it is simple to finish sand and paint. Best of all, its water soluble and easy to clean up. Drying time is longer which gives you plenty of working time. I will never use those smelly, fast drying, chemical-base fillers again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: Not to be used with oil finishes
customer_reviews.text: Over all I’d give it a 2 out of 5 and that is being generous. I typically finish my woodworking with an oil finish specifically Rubio Monocoat. Because the filler is water soluble with an oil finish you can’t really get it to solidify over top. I would imagine if you used some kind of clear coat this would work well, maybe. I wouldn’t use or buy again. I hope this was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: These fillers shrink.
customer_reviews.text: Who;e these fillers are easy to use and easy to clean up, they do shrink a lot. And I also found that with power sanding they often come out of the holes and cracks they filled. So while they might have some use, they are not great.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, looks great, responsive customer service
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned as I have never been able to find putty that can fill in those giant cracks between my 1875 Victorian home's original wood floors planks. This one did the trick. It was perfect consistency, easy to apply, and while I could have played with color a little bit, it blends in fine as is. Will buy again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Hanaanrosenthal

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Used the product as a grain filler for my cabinets that I will be painting white. I applied this and let it dry for 48 hours. I then sanded and then applied latex based primer. The product is mediocre at hiding the grain it is still clearly visible but a little better. However, the Product is coming off as I paint. Very disappointed that it claims it’s paintable but the product loosens up and comes off when in contact with paint! Lot more work for me to do now.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Nice effect, pictures are of red oak, sanded and sealed. I applied the product per instructions, sanded, and shellacked the boards. It looks great. I recommend putting it on and wiping it off with a wet rag across the grain. It keeps from having to re sand too much.
customer_reviews.author: irooster

customer_reviews.title: Oh that smell and mold!
customer_reviews.text: Too liquid, applying it uniformly is mission impossible. Also, the smell of cheap aftershave is unbelievably unpleasant and persistent. Update: it also got moldy!
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Amount of ounces is not accurate on the lid.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an 8 oz jar. The label on top says 8 oz but the size is similar to a salt shaker. The jar is 2” wide and Less than 3” tall. I’m guessing 2 oz. maybe 3 at the most. I don’t have time to send it back as the project was waiting on this. Ask for a picture, I’ll send one.
customer_reviews.author: William E Lofton

customer_reviews.title: Nice Texture for a Wood Putty
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to use and Dries Fast. I really liked using it. It was my first time doing anything with it but..it doesn't smell bad but I recommend wearing gloves when using it. I broke out in a rash just getting on my hands. other than that use disposable gloves and a putty knife. True to color wet and dry.
customer_reviews.author: ZAIRDAWN

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wood filler I have ever used. Easy to apply and blends in perfectly with the color of the wood. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: UK mystery lover

customer_reviews.title: I have so much to learn as a new widow!
customer_reviews.text: Accidentally drilled all the way through the seat of a stool. Right thickness of filler but mistakenly expected a color to blend with cherry wood. This is a raw pinewood color. Hole sealed but color is all wrong. One additional step required now......I shall not make this mistake again!
customer_reviews.author: ETet

customer_reviews.title: Great grain filler
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it’s supposed to do! I used this to fill the grain on old oak cabinets. Play around with the dilution ratio to get the right consistency for running into the grain.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gillet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect name for a perfect product
customer_reviews.text: What a perfect name for this product as it’s a really good “filla”! This stuff applies easily and smoothly, dries quickly, and sands like a dream. This has to be my favorite wood filler to date. I’m repairing a pair of mahogany Duncan Phyfe chairs, and they deserve the best. This is IT.
customer_reviews.author: SteelersGal4Ever

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match for black walnut..Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We own a Construction company and highly recommend this product. The color is a perfect match for heart wood black walnut.
customer_reviews.author: Manifestlife

customer_reviews.title: After it dried i put a high gloss wax on the floor and it looks great.
customer_reviews.text: i used this to fill in gaps and broken corners of a vinyl tile covered floor. After it dried i put a high gloss wax on the floor and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Marietta Winfrey

customer_reviews.title: Very good woodfiller.
customer_reviews.text: This wood filler worked wonders on my damaged solid oak floor. I dug out the water damaged sections of wood and replaced it with this wood filler. It dried hard and solid. I hand painted a wood grain finish and the floor looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Mari Jean

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am Using this for my Lp Fingerboard to fill in slot's that I made too wide, fill's pretty good, I'm not that far with it yet, as I only got it yesterday.....But, So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dulin

customer_reviews.title: Great filler, doesn’t take stain
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was easy to work with, was exactly the color I expected - white oak - and then was frustrating because Minwax Provincial stain didn’t take at all. I fortunately was filling small voids in hardwood flooring and was able to use touch up pens to get the desired color.
customer_reviews.author: Clickman

customer_reviews.title: Great Filler - Takes Finish Well
customer_reviews.text: Used the product to fill natural flaws and knots in some maple that I am working with. So easy to apply, and it dries fast. Had to use a second application on some of the deeper flaws, but that was to be expected. Once sanded smooth, it looks really good against the natural wood. Took the tung oil I’m using as a finish just fine. This was the first time I’ve used this product, but it certainly won’t be the last. Excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: MEC 1117

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this to repair some cracks in a very old butcher block table, and this worked super well! Easy to use, sands evenly and smoothly, takes stain well, and looks great. What else an I say ... this is an overall great product, did the job exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Wow factor!
customer_reviews.text: This product is wonderful! We had several places on a 1940’s piece we were redoing and it rocked! Highly recommend it for taking the wood grain out And filling holes. Can’t go wrong with the ease, smell and look of this product 😁
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is absolutely wonderful and EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED. I have carpenter bees that were making holes in my deck. It was easy to use, dried quickly, and you can honestly barely even see unless you know where to look and look very closely.
customer_reviews.author: nicole marie

customer_reviews.title: I like it! Easy to use, great results.
customer_reviews.text: I’d never used a water-based filler before, but this stuff is really nice. Follow the instructions. Clean it up while wet. Allow it to dry thoroughly, and then clean up any excess. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shikantaza

customer_reviews.title: NOT a good color match.
customer_reviews.text: On what planet does this look like white oak? That looks more closer to red oak to me. NOT a good color match at all. The label says white oak. It’s so off. I had to mix this with their ash colored putty to get a match.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended Product
customer_reviews.text: This product exceeded my expectations. It is easy to work with, but even more than that, it is a perfect walnut color match for the veneer repairs I am making on an antique radio. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't absorb stain
customer_reviews.text: It filled gauges and scratches, but didn't absorb Minwax stain and still shows as almost white after 3 coats of stain.
customer_reviews.author: WT

customer_reviews.title: Not worthed
customer_reviews.text: I received it couple of weeks ago. Applied it on some cracks on my deck prior to overall staining. As seen on the picture the filler has cracks and has not dried yet. It is so thick, I can not even add water to dilute it.. I can not return it since It is opened and used a little. By the way, as it dries it turns in pink color..
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ugell

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff and goes on pretty easy and sands off just as well
customer_reviews.text: Arrive pretty quick after ordering it off Amazon. So far this water-based product is easy to work with (no bad smell like some others) and is grain filling/matching Mahogany wood as expected - pic shows after 2 applications and sanding sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Robo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic color match for what we needed (walnut). Easy to sand and urethane. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great easy to use wood filler
customer_reviews.text: Nice wood filler. Seems strong and works well. I'd recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Paul cross

customer_reviews.title: The best wood filler I have used so far
customer_reviews.text: It really is an excellent product. The fact that it is water-based is perfect. It is easily stored for a long time without losing material. I got maple and the color is matching the wood quite good.
customer_reviews.author: IDI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Tried many, has so.many uses beside filling small holes it is great. Dries fast, sands smooth an takes stain well. Also filled hole in mdf, drilled and held screws with at least 10 pounds of weight.
customer_reviews.author: MylesD

customer_reviews.title: Great Walnut color match
customer_reviews.text: Cant tell where the filler was used. I made some Walnut chairs to match my table and this came in handy. Looks great. Used a dark Watco Oil finish over it and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing filling coverage, unnoticeable
customer_reviews.text: We installed laminate flooring for the 1st time and vinyl plank. Of course there is always a chance of imperfect cuts. This stuff looks just like the flooring on both floors it blends and you cannot even see the cut. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sommerrae

customer_reviews.title: Great dark-toned filler!
customer_reviews.text: This filler is exactly what we needed! We just updated a room with black molding and were NOT looking forward to having to fill and paint all the nail holes. This made the job super simple and straight forward. Nice thick consistency and good saturated black color.
customer_reviews.author: Lizjoyiforous

customer_reviews.title: Not a good filler
customer_reviews.text: Would not recomend this product,dries to a chalk like substance, shrinks, falls out of even the smallest of cracks. ( sawdust mixed with wood glue works just fine)
customer_reviews.author: ChBa

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I use this for filling minor defects in guitar bodies. Spreads and fills easily. Does not crumble. Stains well, before application. Stains well after application. Does not shrink.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great filler in little tub!
customer_reviews.text: Great filler! You can hardly tell there was a flaw before use! I use water based stains in colors so it blends better but it takes stain nicely!
customer_reviews.author: BRADY SIMMONS

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure I like this
customer_reviews.text: Used as a grain filler. A lot different than my old filler. It seems too water soluble and doesn't stay in the grain when I try to clean off the excess.
customer_reviews.author: JazzyCT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is it. This product is fantastic and easy to work with. I wasted money and time on the wood filler I bought at the big stores; never again.
customer_reviews.author: T&M

customer_reviews.title: Natural color is the best!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to get away from the orange stuff! This natural color is the best when you plan to paint over. Remember to coat, as it apparently is not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Boston

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted it to be and made the work a lot longer job.
customer_reviews.text: It isn't usable for filling wood and staining the wood, it comes out more like drywall filler. If you try to you'll have to remove it from the wood or paint over it.
customer_reviews.author: Allen W. Bauck

customer_reviews.title: Sorry not for me
customer_reviews.text: Great smell and easy to sand. Turns soft again very quickly when paintingmaking it hard to paint over. Does not take stain well. Turned gray when adding a beige oul based stain. Not a good experience overall.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D

customer_reviews.title: Superior product!
customer_reviews.text: Used this product for wood modeling--best purchase I ever made of a wood filler! Superior formula only needs one coat, and it cleans up beautifully with a little water. Absolutely the best wood filler on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Serv87

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with.
customer_reviews.text: This product cost more than other wood fillers that I have used but it was worth it. Goes on smoothly, dries fast and sands just like wood.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Works great to fill in holes!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a new home, and there was one room that had holes in the laminate. This stuff filled up the holes and the color matched perfectly. Very pleased! Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Y. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works great, wrong color
customer_reviews.text: They must have sent me the wrong color. I was expecting rosewood but it was an exact match to the mahogany I’m using it for. Why did I want rosewood filler on my mahogany, you ask? I just thought it would look cool. Now I’ll never know. On the plus side the product is easy to work with and takes stain nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Using the Walnut color on Walnut and it matches perfectly. Very easy to work with. Dries quickly. Seems durable (too early too know for sure).
customer_reviews.author: Flea Mkt Louisiana

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a mahogany table top, which requires a very smooth finish.
customer_reviews.author: soyboy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use and the fact that it's water base, means if it does dry up before you use it up, just add water..... Recommend this product highly.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff , not junk at all , give plenty of time to cure before sanding, paintable and stainable...fair price for the medium size
customer_reviews.author: dare adams

customer_reviews.title: cost effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: the product comes in a bottle as tiny as it can be (8 oz), but unless you plan to use it all very quickly, and even then, the price it has is too high. it works essentially as advertised, but it is not cost effective.
customer_reviews.author: srs

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and nice match. Gets real oily though when you let it sit for awhile. Just mix it up and good as new.
customer_reviews.author: JayG

customer_reviews.title: Useless.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived totally dried out and smeared over other items in the same box. Unable to get the right texture even when adding water.
customer_reviews.author: pjs2780

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love its colored to my stain on house. Its easy to use. Its soft and easy to put in cracks or holes. It looks like frosting. Its easy to clean up. Theres no strong smell. Ill will keep this on my fix it list purchases. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Helped fix my entryway
customer_reviews.text: This product was a great help when I had a crack in my entryway. This combined with a little wood glue and some paint and the entryway looks as good as new! You get a lot in the container too so it is good to have in the tool closet in case I need anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: Useless as a grain filler in the form it is shipped in. Has to be watered down heavily to be of any use at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It isn't what I was thinking it didn't work well for me
customer_reviews.author: walter burville

customer_reviews.title: Worked good enough
customer_reviews.text: Used to fill in gaps between planks on farm table. A little difficult to work with as it's hard to get out of the container. Also even after weeks the color comes off when I wipe it. May not be a conventional use for the product. It has worked so far to keep the crumbs from falling between the planks and it does look nice. No cracking.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs

customer_reviews.title: Standard in my shop
customer_reviews.text: The best wood filler I have used. Takes stain very well. It does shrink, but minimally so. Shrinkage increases with water (doesn’t it always 😂). Sands smooth. Excellent for filling grain when thinned. Dries fast. The only wood filler I will use from now on.
customer_reviews.author: DadOfAllTrades

customer_reviews.title: Awesome wood filler!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I should have chosen a darker color but that is my fault. This stuff works great.
customer_reviews.author: JW320

customer_reviews.title: Matches walnut board as much as you could ask for
customer_reviews.text: Matches walnut boards as much as you could ask for. Try adding some dust from your sanding process into the filla for an even better color match.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fill minor blemishes while building a white oak kitchen. Worked great. I used general finishes dye stain and there are a couple places I wasn't sure this would stain well but it was great. I'll buy more in the future once I need it!
customer_reviews.author: nicholas j stahl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Filler & Putty
customer_reviews.text: The best Wood filler / Putty I ever used It apply EZ I dries quick and It sands so smooth
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Product Dissatisfication
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with container broken and contents spilling out into package. Counter top was ruined when I placed package on the counter not realizing that contents were spilling out. Request a replacement order at no cost to me. NO rating at all!
customer_reviews.author: GLMB

customer_reviews.title: Labeled wrong.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and the label on top of the jar says 4.oz. But the description says 8oz. But I weighed it and it weighs 8.6 oz. which is right?I will review the product quality after I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Will Wlodarczyk

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply and clean up with water.
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to use. Wonderful cleanup. Paint covered well. Great that it is water cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: did not take laquer
customer_reviews.text: i am not a wood worker but go ask a hardware person for a recommendation. not happy with this product. color is chocolate. and cracks when lacquer is applied.
customer_reviews.author: Stu P. DeWar

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very impressed with the ease of use and the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel K. Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to apply. Cleanup easy. Wish they offered more colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great filler!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to fill holes in our wood flooring. The floor has black epoxy in it for a rustic look, but several places have popped. This is easy to use and matches exactly. I am still trying to perfect how to get it exactly flush with the flooring, but I like the product.
customer_reviews.author: DinShawnee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easily applicable, a bit like plaster. It dries up like wood.
customer_reviews.author: Minoes

customer_reviews.title: crumbles
customer_reviews.text: Do not put in and large amount on any surface that will take any regular use. I layered, waited two days and two days later crumbled right off. I'm going to BondO
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: The best putty.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best wood putty I've used. I used to always make my own putty because store bought stuff is too obvious on a finished piece. This stuff looks nice and has a subdued color.
customer_reviews.author: K. Justice

customer_reviews.title: Color was good & worked great
customer_reviews.text: Used this to fix cracks in spiral post on the front porch. This was easy to use with excellent results.color was good
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Works as stated. It's water soluble even when dry to be sure to seal it
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this wood filler
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this wood filler. Very easy to use and takes stain, top coat or paint with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Jayhawk714

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for filling in the wood around my windows.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Limberg

customer_reviews.title: Used for 3 months now
customer_reviews.text: Used on multiple wood projects. The filler did harden while in the jar, as the manufacturer said it could. So, just added water and stirred and was then able to continue using the product. Fills in nicely and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Haffner

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of dark furniture with a 'rustic' finish. This stuff's amazing for touch-ups and fill-ins. Very easy to use just be prepared to protect your work area with paper towels or something since it can make a mess while working with it.
customer_reviews.author: W&S

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and doesn't shrink or crack - definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Music Matt

customer_reviews.title: Jar Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Jar Lid leaks a makes a mess. It is very runny. It is just not worth it. Suggest you stay with TimberMate.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

product_meta.title: Water-Based Wood & Grain Filler - Red Oak - 1 Quart by Goodfilla | Replace Every Filler & Putty | Repairs, Finishes & Patches | Paintable, Stainable, Sandable & Quick Drying
product_meta.description: Size:1 Quart| Color:Red OakWater-Based Wood & Grain Filler - Red Oak - 1 Quart By Goodfilla | Replace Every Filler & Putty | Repairs, Finishes & Patches | Paintable, Stainable, Sandable & Quick Drying
feature_bullets: ⚒️ HIGH QUALITY & MONEY SAVING: Save time and money with this wood filler that does not shrink, sink, or crack, and has excellent adhesion. Only need to apply once, and it flawlessly accepts any finish or stain! In fact, this product can be mixed with any pigment, tint, stain or dye.

⚒️ DESIGNED FOR PROFESSIONAL WOODWORKERS: This is the most innovative, easy-to-use, water-based wood filler in the WORLD. Designed for professional woodworkers but perfect for your everyday DIYer, too.

⚒️ HARDY & CONSISTENT: As any woodworker will tell you, they throw hardened wood filler out all the time. But Goodfilla offers an unlimited shelf life since it reconstitutes with water and is freeze-thaw stable.

⚒️ MADE FOR EVERY HANDY-PERSON & WOODWORKER: Whether you have furniture to repair, a floor to finish, a craft to complete or an instrument to finish, this is YOUR product. Sand, stain, tint, prime, fill and seal every knot on your to-do list. Goodfilla is so easy to sand you'll be amazed by how much time you save. BONUS: It's a green product; Zero VOC, zero waste and non-toxic.

⚒️ USA MADE & 100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: Your experience with this product is our number one priority. If your Goodfilla wood filler doesn't do everything you need it to do with ease, we'll refund your money up to 365 days with no questions asked!
